block.p: Sandra Natalie Kim, a daughter of Sun Yung Kim and Yongyop Kim of San Francisco, is to be married today in Hawaii to Carl Frederick Salas, a son of Julie Terlaje Salas and Dr. Jose S. S. Salas of Wellesley, Mass. Judge Rhonda I. L. Loo of the Hawaii District Court in Wailuku is to officiate at the Four Seasons Resort in Wailea, Maui.

The bride, 33, is a vice president and the United States entertainment industry analyst in New York for Schroders, the British investment-management company. She graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and received an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago. Her father retired as an architect for the Lawrence Berkeley Laboratory in Berkeley. Her mother, also retired, was a researcher in molecular biology at Berkeley.

Sandra Natalie Kim, a daughter of Sun Yung Kim and Yongyop Kim of San Francisco, is to be married today in Hawaii to Carl Frederick Salas, a son of Julie Terlaje Salas and Dr. Jose S. S. Salas of Wellesley, Mass. Judge Rhonda I. L. Loo of the Hawaii District Court in Wailuku is to officiate at the Four Seasons Resort in Wailea, Maui.

The bride, 33, is a vice president and the United States entertainment industry analyst in New York for Schroders, the British investment-management company. She graduated from the University of California at Berkeley and received an M.B.A. from the University of Chicago. Her father retired as an architect for the Lawrence Berkeley Laboratory in Berkeley. Her mother, also retired, was a researcher in molecular biology at Berkeley.

The bridegroom, 40, is a managing director and an investment banker in New York with the entertainment and media industries group of Banc of America Securities. He graduated from Dartmouth College, was an Air Force lieutenant stationed at Williams Air Force Base near Phoenix and later received an M.B.A. from Columbia. His father, a retired orthopedic surgeon, practiced in Wellesley and in Natick, Mass.
